articles.author: The Associated Press
articles.description: The Wagner Group's presence extends from the ancient battlegrounds of Syria to the deserts of sub-Saharan Africa, projecting the Kremlin's global influence with mercenaries accused of using brutal force and profiting from seized mineral riches.
articles.title: Russia's Wagner mercenaries face uncertainty after the presumed death of its leader in a plane crash

articles.author: AARON MORRISON
articles.description: WASHINGTON (AP) — Martin Luther King III, along with his wife, Arndrea Waters King, and their 15-year-old daughter, Yolanda, have developed a set of traditions for this time of the year. Each August, they rewatch the Rev.
articles.title: Tens of thousands expected for March on Washington’s 60th anniversary demonstration

articles.author: MARI YAMAGUCHI
articles.description: IWAKI, Japan (AP) — Fish auction prices at a port south of the Fukushima Daiichi nuclear power plant were mixed amid uncertainty over how seafood consumers will respond to the release of treated and diluted radioactive wastewater into the ocean.
articles.title: Fukushima residents are cautious after the wrecked nuclear plant began releasing treated wastewater

articles.author: THOMAS BEAUMONT
articles.description: PELLA, Iowa (AP) — Vivek Ramaswamy has charged back into Iowa, stoking curiosity and skepticism after his attention-grabbing performance in the first Republican presidential debate.
articles.title: Ramaswamy faces curiosity and skepticism in Iowa after center-stage performance in GOP debate

articles.author: BOBBY CAINA CALVAN, JAE C. HONG and MIKE HOUSEHOLDER
articles.description: LAHAINA, Hawaii (AP) — Families were torn asunder. A community is reeling with grief. More than 100 people have perished and hundreds more remain missing after flames and smoke barreled from the hills and annihilated the historic town of Lahaina.
articles.title: Hawaii's cherished notion of family, the 'ohana, endures in tragedy's aftermath

articles.author: JACK DURA
articles.description: BISMARCK, N.D. (AP) — The beloved wild horses that roam freely in North Dakota's Theodore Roosevelt National Park could be removed under a National Park Service proposal that worries advocates who say the horses are a cultural link to the past.
articles.title: Beloved wild horses that roam Theodore Roosevelt National Park may be removed. Many oppose the plan

articles.author: SUSIE BLANN
articles.description: KYIV, Ukraine (AP) — Russian forces struck a cafe in a key front-line area in northeastern Ukraine Saturday, killing two civilians and wounding a third, regional officials said. The shelling near the city of Kupiansk came as U.K.
articles.title: Shelling kills civilians in Ukraine's northeast as fears grow of a second Russian takeover

articles.author: SUSAN HAIGH
articles.description: Wildfires forced Amanda Dengler to flee her home in Canada’s Northwest Territories three times in the past 18 months, and each time her cats have evaded her attempts to bring them along.
articles.title: Beloved pets in Canada rescued from wildfires by volunteers who stayed behind

articles.author: MARCIA DUNN
articles.description: CAPE CANAVERAL, Fla. (AP) — Four astronauts from four countries rocketed toward the International Space Station on Saturday.They should reach the orbiting lab in their SpaceX capsule Sunday, replacing four astronauts living up there since March.
articles.title: New crew for the space station launches with 4 astronauts from 4 countries

articles.author: HANNAH FINGERHUT
articles.description: DES MOINES, Iowa (AP) — One of Iowa's largest cities repealed its ban on “conversion therapy” — the discredited practice of trying to change a person’s sexual orientation or gender identity through counseling — after a Christian organization threatened legal action, part of a deepening national movement to challenge protections for LGBTQ+ kids.
articles.title: In Iowa and elsewhere, bans on LGBTQ+ ‘conversion therapy’ become a conservative target
